Activity: Arrive at the office, log in to the system, and check emails for urgent requests or updates. Briefly review the weekly goal: abstracting data from the 2023-2024 influenza season with a target of 200 records, prioritizing electronic ones.

Review the established protocol for influenza data abstraction to ensure consistency and adherence to guidelines. Refresh knowledge on data fields needed, including demographics, vaccination status, symptoms, diagnosis codes (ICD-10), lab results, and treatment details.

Begin accessing the electronic health record (EHR) system. Prepare a list of patient identifiers (medical record numbers) to efficiently pull up patient records for review. Focus initially on patients seen during the 2023-2024 influenza season.

Start abstracting data from the first EHR. Systematically review the patient's record, extracting relevant data points and documenting them in a secure spreadsheet. Ensure accurate transcription of information.
Continue EHR abstraction. Focus on efficiency and accuracy, taking short breaks as needed to maintain concentration.
Resume EHR abstraction. Analyze the first set of 30 records, identifying potential data entry errors or inconsistencies in the EHR system.
Communicate with @HIS-1 and @HIS-2 about any potential data entry error. @HIS-1 @HIS-2 Data Error in EHR System
Continue with EHR abstraction for another 30 records. Total target 60 for the day.
Review today's progress. Verify that at least 60 records have been abstracted. Note any challenges encountered during the data abstraction process.
Organize the day's abstracted data and back up the spreadsheet to a secure server.
Log off and leave for the day.
